intro: Nautilocalyx villosus, commonly known as the hairy nautilocalyx, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are borne in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
